page.title: 13RIDGE CHURCH
page.content: THE CHURCH AT RIDGE WAS BUILT IN THE EARLY 15TH CENTURY.ENTER THROUGH A PORCH AND IMMEDIETELLY INSIDE IS A BIG MURAL WITH A PAINTING OF ST.CHRISTOPHE R.AT THE BACK OF THE CHURCH THERE IS A FONT WHICH IS USED FOR BAPTIZING PEOPLE AND BRINGING THEM INTO THE FAITH.AS YOU WALK DOWN THE NAVE THERE ARE PEWS ON EACH SIDE.AT THE END OF THE NAVE THERE IS A PULPIT WHICH THE VICAR STANDS ON TO GIVE THE SURMAN AND A LECTURN FOR THE BIBLE.AT THE FRONT THERE IS AN ALTER,ALTER RAIL,ORGAN AND BENCHES FOR THE CHOIR.THE ALTER IS USED TO MAKE A SACRIFICE OF THE HOLY COMMUNION,THE ORGAN IS QUITE SMALL,AND IS USED FOR PLAYING HYMNS.THE BENCHES HAVE CARVED MICE ON THEM,THE MICE ARE A TRADEMARK OF A MAN WHO MADE THE BENCHES.ABOVE THE ALTER THERE IS A STAIN GLASS WINDOW OF ST.MARGRET OF ANTIOCH.
